video.description: You don't need to go to a restaurant to taste a fresh Caesar salad. In this video, you'll learn helpful tips and tricks to make the easy, delicious, and satisfying dish. The classic salad dressing is made with olive oil, garlic, and anchovies. Allow the strong flavors to sit for a half hour before toasting the croutons and adding eggs to the dressing. Tear off chunks of romaine lettuce by hand, tossing in Parmesan cheese.

name: Caesar Salad
keywords: Crouton, Garlic, Romaine Lettuce, Salad, American

nutrition.servingSize: Serves 4-6 for a main course or up to 8-12 for a side salad

recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup high quality extra virgin olive oil, plus more for brushing
1 baguette, preferably a day old, thinly sliced
1/4 cup fresh lemon juice (plus more to taste)
1 teaspoon anchovy paste, or 1-2 anchovies, minced
1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper (or to taste)
4-6 small heads of romaine lettuce, rinsed, patted dry, wilted outer leaves discarded

recipeInstructions.text: Combine olive oil and garlic: In a very large bowl, whisk together 1/2 cup olive oil and garlic. Let sit for at least half an hour.

Make the toasted croutons: While the garlic is sitting, make the croutons. Spread the baguette slices out on a baking sheet. (You may need to do in batches.) Brush or spray with olive oil (or melted butter). If you want garlicky croutons, dip pastry brush in the garlic infused oil you have sitting in Step 1. Broil for a couple of minutes until the tops are lightly browned. (Note: do not walk away, these can easily go from browned to burnt.) Remove and let cool. The steps up until this point can be made ahead.

Make the dressing: Add minced anchovies (or anchovy paste, if using) and eggs to the oil-garlic mixture. Whisk until creamy. Add salt and pepper and 1/4 cup of lemon juice. Whisk in half of the Parmesan cheese. Taste, add more lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste. The lemon should give an edge to the dressing, but not overwhelm it.

Tear off chunks of romaine lettuce: Using your hands, tear off chunks of lettuce from the heads of romaine lettuce (do not use a knife to cut). Add to the dressing and toss until coated. Add the rest of the Parmesan cheese, and toss.
Combine and serve: Coarsely chop the toasted bread into croutons and add to the salad. Brush in any crumbs from chopping the bread, too. Toss and serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: I did not love this recipe. The dressing was very thin and not terribly flavorful. I ended up adding a lot more lemon, anchovy, and cheese. Next time I would use just the egg yolks and a lot less oil.

A nice addition to the dressing is a couple of dashes of Tabasco sauce. It goes really well.



When I go to a restaurant and order a Caesar salad, I always ask for some Tabasco to put on top.
How many people does this feed? I am just making for me and my boyfriend!
What are the calories for the salad?
Delicious. Made croutons with butter & cut them small. Recipe is enough for quite a lot of romaine. Will try to make half the recipe (Used ersatz eggs, so it's possible).
